item.title: Water egress from drain whenever it rains leads to A435 flooding 200 metres to north., 3rd January
item.description:
Location A435 approx 100 metres north of junction with Malleson Road. Whenever it rains water pours from this drain leading to shallow flood in the dip 200 metres north on the A435 where there is a culvert. Especially dangerous in frosty conditions as salt is washed away and the road is covered by black ice. Persistent problem since resurfacing of road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excess rubbish accumulated on The Golden Valley Bypass, 3rd January

item.title: Rubbish on the verges along the whole of The Golden Valley Bypass, 3rd January
item.description:
A large amount of rubbish has accumulated on The Golden Valley Bypass (A40). The verges have just been cut revealing the rubbish. Such a disgusting welcome to Cheltenham Town from Gloucester and also away from Cheltenahm too.. Cheltenham side and Gloucester side of the M5..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Rocking and broken slabs on a narrow stretch of pavement on Montpellier Walk outside The Ivy/Harry Cook and further along outside AllBarOne, 3rd January
item.description:
Rocking and broken slabs on a narrow stretch of pavement on Montpellier Walk outside The Ivy/Harry Cook and further along outside AllBarOne. This has been like this for years, why is it not being fixed yet? An elderly person or anyone can easily trip up and hurt themselves, its ridiculous nothing is being done!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 3rd January
item.description:
02/01/24 email rcvd - Hello, This is the first time I’ve emailed you and would like to know if your aware of the severe traffic jams on Swindon Road Cheltenham due to the traffic lights not being sequenced which cause long queues especially from the Royal Mail sorting office end (GL50 4BJ) which often go all the way to Tewkesbury Road and the cause is the lights outside the brewery quarter GL50 4FA not letting the traffic at the Lidl Swindon Road GL50 4AH lights not being able to clear both together, its actually quicker to go through the town centre to avoid this and that shouldnt be right? Thanks for now
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles
